001package imagingbook.pub.dft;
002
003/**
004 * Interface specifying all one-dimensional DFT/FFT implementations.
005 */
006public interface Dft1d {
007        
008        public interface Float extends Dft1d {
009                /**
010                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT forward transformation on the supplied data.
011                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
012                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
013                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
014                 */
015                void forward(float[] gRe, float[] gIm);
016                
017                /**
018                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
019                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
020                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
021                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
022                 */
023                void inverse(float[] GRe, float[] GIm);
024                
025                /**
026                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
027                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
028                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
029                 * 
030                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
031                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
032                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
033                 */
034                void transform(float[] inRe, float[] inIm, boolean forward);
035                
036                default void checkSize(float[] re, float[] im, int n) {
037                        if (re.length != n || im.length != n)
038                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of size " + n);
039                }
040                
041                default void checkSize(float[] re, float[] im) {
042                        if (re.length != im.length)
043                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
044                }
045                
046                /**
047                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 1D data.
048                 * @param re the real part of the data
049                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
050                 * @return a 1D array of magnitude values
051                 */
052                default float[] getMagnitude(float[] re, float[] im) {
053                        checkSize(re, im);
054                        final int n = re.length;
055                        float[] mag = new float[n];
056                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
057                                float a = re[i];
058                                float b = im[i];
059                                mag[i] = (float) Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
060                        }
061                        return mag;
062                }
063                
064        }
065        
066        public interface Double extends Dft1d {
067                
068                /**
069                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT forward transformation on the supplied data.
070                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
071                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
072                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
073                 */
074                void forward(double[] gRe, double[] gIm);
075                
076                /**
077                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
078                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
079                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
080                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
081                 */
082                void inverse(double[] GRe, double[] GIm);
083                
084                /**
085                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
086                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
087                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
088                 * 
089                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
090                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
091                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
092                 */
093                void transform(double[] inRe, double[] inIm, boolean forward);
094                
095                default void checkSize(double[] re, double[] im, int n) {
096                        if (re.length != n || im.length != n)
097                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of size " + n);
098                }
099                
100                default void checkSize(double[] re, double[] im) {
101                        if (re.length != im.length)
102                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
103                }
104                
105                /**
106                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 1D data.
107                 * @param re the real part of the data
108                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
109                 * @return a 1D array of magnitude values
110                 */
111                default double[] getMagnitude(double[] re, double[] im) {
112                        checkSize(re, im);
113                        final int n = re.length;
114                        double[] mag = new double[n];
115                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
116                                double a = re[i];
117                                double b = im[i];
118                                mag[i] = (double) Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
119                        }
120                        return mag;
121                }
122        }
123        
124}
